intro: Anacamptis × laniccae nothosubsp. laniccae, commonly known as the long-lipped orchid, is a hybrid species within the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, spurred flowers that typically bloom in late summer. The plant produces dark green, lance-shaped leaves and has a preference for moist, calcareous soils in woodland or meadow habitats. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in regions with temperate climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
